text: today's cookie day one of our favorite
days of the week and I'm making the
lemon sugar cookie and it couldn't be
simpler I have three cups of all-purpose
flour to that I'm adding a teaspoon of
baking soda and a quarter teaspoon of
fine salt you're using your core salt
just make sure that you use a half a
teaspoon instead
whisk everything together people often
under whisk and I experienced under
whisking in a carrot cake that I made
and all my carrots turned green because
my baking soda wasn't properly
incorporated what's really insane so
whisk properly set that aside for a sec
then you need a tablespoon of grated
lemon zest make sure to really well
scrub your lemons and if you can find
pesticide free lemons even better
add your tablespoon of lemon zest to 1
and 3/4 cups of granulated sugar in a
mixer and then to that add a quarter cup
of light brown sugar beat those together
for like one or two minutes when you can
really strongly smell your lemon add 2
sticks of unsalted butter room temp beat
until light
once your sugar and butter are well
combined and fluffy you can add two eggs
one at a time
and then a tablespoon of lemon juice
and then add your flour mixture be sure
that you're careful when you turn your
mixer back on because well you know as
well as I do what happens flour
everywhere careful careful
done I have some parchment lined baking
sheets here this is a 2-inch scoop so
these are going to be kind of big
cookies scoop the cookies you want to
leave about two inches between each
cookie so there's plenty of room to
spread you'll want to flatten the
cookies a little bit I'm just using my
hands and then to a really unique and
special topping sprinkle the tops of
your cookies with coarse sanding sugar
then you go in and you brush that with a
little bit of water this helps it to
adhere and create the first layer of
sugar enos and then you go back in and
sprinkle with another layer of sugar and
it's gonna be amazing it's the crack
aleus sparkly escy you've ever seen have
your oven preheating to 350 degrees and
these cookies will need to bake for
about 15 minutes you'll probably want to
rotate the pan once while they're making
when they're done they're crackling on
top a little sparkly on top I'm just
going to go ahead and taste one because
well I just can't wait hmm you hear that
like a little bit crunchy but in the
center they're chewy so it's the best of
both worlds mmm
it's a lemony sugar cookie as simple as
can be I love it and I think you're
gonna love it too
